intro: Moehringia lebrunii, commonly known as the lebrun's mouse-ear, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in countries like Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its flowers are usually pink or white, appearing in clusters and blooming in late spring to early summer. Moehringia lebrunii is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and is often found in high-altitude meadows.
